ques: Open the menu of Allrecipes, find the trends in News, click on one article, and briefly describe what type of food the article is about.
Search for KFC Copycat Gravy on Allrecipes, view the recipe, and click on reviews. How many people rated it 1 star?
Search for Banana Bread on Allrecipes, browse the results page, and list 3 recipes with ratings below 500.
Check 'BBQ & Grilling' in Allrecipes' kitchen tips. Is there a recipe related to watermelon?
List 3 Chinese foods mentioned in the Cuisines section of Allrecipes.
Check Amazon's Best sellers and list 2 products in Best sellers in Electronics.
Search for Hirudoid Cream 20g on Amazon and briefly describe its purpose.
Scroll through Amazon's homepage and list 10 promotional headlines.
Search for 'kindle' on Amazon, look at the filter on the results page. What brands are there? What Connectivity Technology options are available?
Check out deals in the Amazon Basics section.
Click on the vision section on Apple's website and view the tech specs of Vision Pro. Scroll down to Chips and briefly describe the information about the chips used.
Check Apple support to see how to resolve "If you forgot your Apple ID password."
In the iPhone section on Apple's website, click on compare to compare models. Please compare iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro, and scroll down to see the difference in their chips.
Look at AirPods Max on Apple's official website, scroll down to find Tech Specs. What colors are currently available?
In the iPad section on Apple's website, find Apple Pencil. What is the slogan displayed on the current page?
Browse the ArXiv homepage and list all the major subjects displayed on the homepage.
Scroll to the bottom of the ArXiv homepage and check 'Who We Are'. Who are currently on the arXiv Advisory Board?

Click on ArXiv's Advanced Search, add another term in the Search terms (search by Authors), search for 'Web Agent' in Title and search for 'John' in Author(s). (Note: Since pressing Enter automatically after input, selecting 'refine query' is needed for searching by Title before inputting Author(s).)
Search for 'AI Psychology' on ArXiv, currently searching in 'All fields'. How many results are there? If the search is changed from 'All fields' to 'Title', how many results are there?
Find 'Pattern Formation and Solitons' in Physics on ArXiv. What are the two most recent days? How many submissions are there for this category on each of these days?
How many subsections are there in the Innovation section of BBC News? Click on a subsection related to AI and check what the current headline article is.
In the News category on BBC News, look for Asia news. While browsing the page, are there any news related to natural disasters?
Search for 'Spaceflight' on BBC News. Look at the latest article and summarize its viewpoint.
In the Sport category of BBC, check the Top Scorers for Football. Who are the Top Scorer and Top Assist in the current table?
Click on the Sport section of BBC and explore the sports programs in that section. Look at all A-Z Sports. Which sports beginning with 'G' are listed?

Close any pop-ups that may appear on the Booking website. Click on the calendar, select the nearest 3 days, input 'California' as the location, and browse the results page to identify a hotel with a rating higher than 8.0.

Search for hotels near Brussels Central Station on Booking for the dates October 24th to October 27th (remember to click the 'Search' button after input). Sort the results by 'Price (lowest first)' and identify the name of the first hotel listed.

Scroll down the Booking homepage to 'Browse by property type' and click on 'Villas'. Next, search for Villas in Nashville. Firstly, select the dates on the page as October 3, 2024, to October 8, 2024, and then input 'Nashville' to search. Identify the first result that appears.
Click on 'Attractions' on the Booking homepage to view all recommended locations. Are there any locations with a rating of 4.8?

Upon opening the Booking website, set the check-in and check-out dates as September 30, 2024, to October 5, 2024, then search for 'Columbia'. While scrolling through the results page, list the major categories included in the filters on the left. Mention at least 8 categories.
Open the menu of Cambridge Dictionary, click on "shop", and list 3 categories of products.
Look up the word "incomprehensibility" and provide the 2 examples given on the webpage.
Navigate to Cambridge Dictionary's plus section and find "Image quizzes". What are the categories of Image quizzes available there?
Browse the grammar section of Cambridge Dictionary. In the English Grammar page, what are the key features listed?
Explore the English Thesaurus on Cambridge Dictionary. What are the popular articles available on that page?
Click on "explore" in Coursera's menu. Select the goal as "Take a free course". On the current page, what are 3 recommended courses listed?
Search for the course "Football: More than a Game" on Coursera. List the names of all 6 modules in that course.
Search for "Healthcare AI" on Coursera. Under "Filter by Subject" on the results page, how many options are there in total? Click "show more" and list all the options.
Check the advantages of "Coursera for business" in the menu. Then click on "Contact us". What information do you need to fill in?
Search for "Introduction to Electronics" on Coursera. Who are the two Instructors of this course?
Besides the sports displayed on the ESPN homepage, there are more sports in the dropdown list. Find "chess", and summarize its latest news.
Search for "New England Patriots" on ESPN. When is their next game scheduled?
Click consecutively on "NBA - standings" on ESPN. In the Eastern Conference, which team is ranked first when sorted by PCT and PPG respectively?
Check the Schedule for MMA on ESPN. Which matches are scheduled for this week?
View the "scores" section for football on ESPN. Select the date as August 22, 2024. What matches were played on that day?
What are the items in the Open Source and Enterprise dropdown menus on the GitHub homepage?
Check the Security section in the GitHub product section to understand the roles of Code scanning and Supply chain.
Find Startup in GitHub's Solutions, learn about the role of GitHub for Startups, and what advantages does it offer?
Search for PythonRobotics in the search button at the top right corner of GitHub. Check the filters on the results page.
Click on GitHub's search button, then search for in-context learning. What is the best match at this moment, and what if you add 'created:>2024-08-10' to limit the time?
On Google Flights, perform the following actions: open the calendar, enter Departure as 2024-10-24 and Return as 2024-10-28 using Action 'Type', then click done.
Check the page layout of Google Flights. Besides Round Trip, what other trip types can you select? What types of passengers and cabins can you choose from?
Look for flights from Bruges, Belgium to London, round-trip. Click on October 10 and October 15 using the 'Click' method. Provide details from the first result.

Enter the dates 10/22/2024-10/26/2024 on Google Flights. If you first type in 10/22/2024 and then click on October 26, you may not be able to select the correct date. How can you improve this? Is it feasible to change all inputs to clicks or vice versa?
Scroll down the homepage of Google Flights to view the Frequently Asked Questions.
Search for Irvine on Google Maps. Click on the right arrow at the top right of the map, find the 'ATMs' button, and list the two results shown.
Search for 90050 on Google Maps, then search for Disney in the nearby area. What are some places related to Disney nearby?

Search for Park in Chicago on Google Maps, which will yield many results. List 5 relevant results. (Note: Use scrolling within the left-hand area by selecting the numerical label of the heading or a shown result on the left to scroll within that area).

Use Google Maps to search for Lakewood. Complete the following actions: scroll to the bottom of the left-hand area (non-map area), where you will find a photo. Describe the content of that photo. (Note: Use scrolling within the left-hand area by selecting the numerical label of the heading or a shown result on the left to scroll within that area).
Open the menu on Google Maps. What options are available to select?
Click on the search bar of Google, trending searches will appear. If there are any related to a specific person, click on that option to see an overview of the search results.
Click on "settings" at the bottom of the Google page. What options are available there? Click on "send feedback" to learn how to send feedback through that page.
Search for the system requirements of 'Black Myth: Wukong'.
Search for 'hello world' on Google, click on the shopping section. What related products can you see?
Search for Avatar, click to enter Wikipedia, then browse the page to find the movie's Directed by and Music by.

Click on the Models section on the Hugging Face homepage. There are currently 3 text boxes on the page. Briefly describe the purpose of each text box and which one should be used to search for models by name.

Go to the Models section on Hugging Face, enter 'idefics' in the right text box for search. How many results are there? If you then select the 'Text-to-Image' filter on the left, how many results remain?
What are some popular Spaces on Huggingface this week?
In the Datasets section of Huggingface, select the '3D' and 'Video' modes. What results are there?
In the Docs section of Huggingface, look up the installation method for Transformers.js.
Browse the homepage of Wolfram Alpha. What entries are included under 'Society & Culture'?
Click on the Computational Sciences category in Wolfram Alpha, and look for examples for Image Processing. How can you apply a morphological operator to an image using Wolfram Alpha?
In Wolfram Alpha, search for a triangle. Scroll down the results page to see how the height and area of a triangle are calculated based on its three sides.
Click on "upgrade to pro" to see the annual price for Wolfram Alpha Pro for students. What additional features does it offer compared to Basic?
On Wolfram Alpha, plot x^2+(y-sqrt(|x|))^2=1. What does the resulting image look like?
